title: How to Get Past the Activation Lock on an iPhone or iPad without the Seller

steps.title: Visit Apple's Activation Lock support page.
steps.content: Visit Apple's Activation Lock support page. If you can't contact the original owner of your device, Apple Support may help. Apple Support has a dedicated contact page for Activation Lock issues. [1] X Research source Navigate to the Apple Support Activation Lock additional support page .

steps.title: Follow the on-screen prompts.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen prompts. You must provide your email address as well as your phone's serial number , IMEI, or MEID . Apple will also need proof of purchase of your device. You can find the serial number, IMEI , or MEID when you're setting up your device. Press the power button until you see the Apple logo, then tap the "i" button in the bottom right corner to see the number.

steps.title: Be aware that Apple may deny your request.
steps.content: Be aware that Apple may deny your request. Apple reserves the right to not approve any activation lock removal requests that it deems suspicious or untrustworthy.

steps.title: Restart your device
steps.content: Restart your device . If you're stuck at the activation lock screen, restarting your device will allow you to begin the device set-up again. Note: This method may not work for all users depending on what iOS or iPadOS version was installed on the device when it was reset.

steps.title: Set up the device until you get the Wi-Fi settings page.
steps.content: Set up the device until you get the Wi-Fi settings page. This should be the section after choosing your country and language.

steps.title: Tap the i button next to your desired network.
steps.content: Tap the i button next to your desired network.

steps.title: Modify the DNS settings.
steps.content: Modify the DNS settings. Scroll towards the bottom of the screen, then click Configure DNS and select the Manual option.

steps.title: Input the new DNS.
steps.content: Input the new DNS. There are different DNS addresses depending on your location. North America – 104.154.51.7 South America – 35.199.88.219 Europe – 104.155.28.90 Asia – 104.155.220.58 Australia and Oceania – 35.189.47.23

steps.title: Tap the Back button and connect to your desired network.
steps.content: Tap the Back button and connect to your desired network. Select the Wi-Fi network you just edited and enter the password when prompted.

steps.title: Tap the Back button when the device tries to activate.
steps.content: Tap the Back button when the device tries to activate. If you were successful you should be able to bypass the activation lock. This method will not unlock your phone fully, and many of your phone's features will not be available. The activation lock will also reappear after you restart your phone. This method may not work for every device, especially newer versions of iOS. If you are unable to bypass the activation lock this way you may want to try contacting Apple Support for help.

steps.title: Some activation lock removal apps require you to jailbreak the device.
steps.content: Some activation lock removal apps require you to jailbreak the device. These apps have generally poor reviews online. Users state they have paid for the service only for it to not work in the end. These apps also usually require you to jailbreak your device, which can leave your device open to security threats.

steps.title: Activation lock removal services have generally poor reviews.
steps.content: Activation lock removal services have generally poor reviews. Many users state that services that claim to unlock your phone are a scam , many reporting that they paid for a service and their device was never unlocked.

steps.title: If it seems too good to be true, it likely is.
steps.content: If it seems too good to be true, it likely is. Anyone that offers to unlock your device for free is likely attempting to scam you. Only accept help for this issue from a person or business that you trust.
